Class ec.ezlib.base.VectorSugar 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----ec.ezlib.base.VectorSugar
public class VectorSugar
extends Object
The EZ semantics of a Vector is a mutable Table whose keys are the integers from 0 thru size()-1.

add(Vector, Object)
Returns a new array that is the concatenation of this Vector with other.
asArray(Vector)
Copy's the contents of the Vector into an array.
containsKey(Vector, Object)
The keys to an array are the integers from 0 thru size()-1
each(Vector, AssocFunc)
Considered as a Table, a Vector is a mapping from indices to values, so each() will call func with each successive pair of index and value, in ascending index order.
get(Vector, int)
If the index is in bounds, return the corresponding element.
get(Vector, Object, Object)
If the index is in bounds, return the corresponding element.
isIdentity(Vector)
Considered as a Table, a Vector does not index based on identity.
keys(Vector)
The resulting Enumeration will enumerate the integers from 0 thru size() -1.
keyType(Vector)
The keys of an array must be integers
length(Vector)
Vector size() and length() are the same thing.
multiply(Vector, int)
Returns the array resulting from concatenating this 'reps' copies of this vector.
put(Vector, int, Object)
slice(Vector, int)
bound defaults to size()
slice(Vector, int, int)
Returns a new array containing the part of this one from start thru bound-1.
toString(Vector)
Need to provide our own until Vector.toString()'s bug is fixed.
valueType(Vector)
The values may be any object

toString 
 public static String toString(Vector vec)
Need to provide our own until Vector.toString()'s bug is fixed.

length 
 public static int length(Vector vec)
Vector size() and length() are the same thing.

containsKey 
 public static boolean containsKey(Vector vec,
                                   Object key)
The keys to an array are the integers from 0 thru size()-1

get 
 public static Object get(Vector vec,
                          int index) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
If the index is in bounds, return the corresponding element. Otherwise throw an IndexOutOfBoundsException

get 
 public static Object get(Vector vec,
                          Object index,
                          Object instead)
If the index is in bounds, return the corresponding element. Otherwise return 'instead'.

put 
 public static void put(Vector vec,
                        int index,
                        Object newValue)
keys 
 public static Enumeration keys(Vector vec)
The resulting Enumeration will enumerate the integers from 0 thru size() -1.

asArray 
 public static Object[] asArray(Vector vec)
Copy's the contents of the Vector into an array.

each 
 public static void each(Vector vec,
                         AssocFunc func) throws Throwable
Considered as a Table, a Vector is a mapping from indices to values, so each() will call func with each successive pair of index and value, in ascending index order. It does this over a snapshot of the Vector, so that changes to the Vector during enumeration don't effect the enumeration.

isIdentity 
 public static boolean isIdentity(Vector vec)
Considered as a Table, a Vector does not index based on identity. XXX This is probably not a concept in EZ's semantics, in which case this method should be removed, and the corresponding Table method should be hidden.

keyType 
 public static Class keyType(Vector vec)
The keys of an array must be integers

valueType 
 public static Class valueType(Vector vec)
The values may be any object

slice 
 public static Object slice(Vector vec,
                            int start,
                            int bound) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
Returns a new array containing the part of this one from start thru bound-1.

slice 
 public static Object slice(Vector vec,
                            int start) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
bound defaults to size()

add 
 public static Object add(Vector vec,
                          Object other)
Returns a new array that is the concatenation of this Vector with other. other may be an array or a Vector.

multiply 
 public static Object multiply(Vector vec,
                               int reps)
Returns the array resulting from concatenating this 'reps' copies of this vector.
